text.__SUMMARY__:
Fritillaria reuteri is a perennial herbaceous bulbous plant, distributed in Turkey and Iran.
It is a species in the genus Fritillaria, in the family Liliaceae. It is placed in the subgenus Fritillaria.
text.Description: Characterised by purplish-brown flowers, tall stems, and narrow leaves. Each pedicel bears two bracts at the base. Flowering May to June.
text.Taxonomy: First described by Boissier in 1844, Baker (1874), who divided Fritillaria into subgenera, placed F. reuteri in subgenus Monocodon, a subgenus later subsumed into Fritillaria. Modern classifications, based on molecular phylogenetics, confirm this placement.
text.Distribution and habitat: High mountainous areas west of Esfahan, Iran, in wet soil or running water.
